snippet: Rival prime-time news divisions conjured up Kennedy in interesting and depressing ways on Wednesday night.
abstract: Rival prime-time news divisions conjured up Kennedy in interesting and depressing ways on Wednesday night.
lead_paragraph: Rival network-news divisions were part of a strange, coincidental Camelot convergence on their prime-time shows on Wednesday night: Both summoned the ghost of President John F. Kennedy but to very different ends (beyond ratings, that is). Between them, they covered the two main approaches that network news takes when it operates in prime time: fawning (CBS's brand-new "Person to Person," featuring George Clooney with Kennedy memorabilia) and censorious (NBC's "Rock Center With Brian Williams," about a JFK affair).

headline.main: Prime-Time News and the Ghost of JFK
